initialize(address).details: Initializes the contract setting the deployer as the initial owner.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._id: vault creator's unique id using which it can be reached, eg, its Google/APNS token
params._pin: the PIN number of the signer (participant)

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._id: vault creator's unique id using which it can be reached, eg, its Google/APNS token
params._transferee: address of the new vault operator

addParticipant(bytes32,string,bytes32,st.notice: This function adds a participant to a vault that belongs to its creator

checkQuorum(bytes32,string,bytes32,uint2.notice: This function lets the creator check if quorum has been achieved for a particular transaction

confirmParticipant(bytes32,string,bytes3.notice: This function confirms a participant in the vault when the participant sends its private key shard and PIN

createVault(bytes32,string).notice: This function creates a vault for the creator

defineQuorum(bytes32,string,uint256).notice: This function defines the number of participants required to co-sign a transaction

getCreator(bytes32,uint256).notice: This function returns the vault creator's unique ID (eg, Google/APNS messaging token)

getShards(bytes32,string,uint256).notice: This function gets the shard for a participant

getVaults().notice: This function returns list of vault creators

promptSignatures(bytes32,string).notice: This function prompts participants to co-sign a transaction on the vault (ie, the creator's address secured by the quorum of participants)

removeParticipant(bytes32,string,bytes32.notice: This function removes a participant in a vault that belongs to its creator

signTransaction(bytes32,string,bytes32,u.notice: This function lets a participant co-sign a transaction

transferVault(bytes32,string,address).notice: This function transfers a vault from the transferor (msg.sender) to transferee
